column.name: CUSTOMER_ORDER_ID
column.comment: - This column stores a unique identifier for the CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: PART_FLAG
column.comment: PART_FLAG - technical use for partitioning table on source system

column.name: CHANGE_TYPE
column.comment: The type of change allowed for this type of payment. Valid for POS payments only.

column.name: LOADTM
column.comment: - data warehouse entry change date timestamp (Original name in the DWHDB "_LOADTM")

column.name: CUSTOMER_NUMBER
column.comment: - This column stores the id of the Customer that owns this CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: BILL_ACTIVATION_INDICATOR
column.comment: BILL_ACTIVATION_INDICATOR - The bill activation indicator specifies whether a CUSTOMER`s request  for SERVICE has been processed. When it has been processed, the  CUSTOMER has been activated for billing.

column.name: CREATE_DATE
column.comment: - This column shows the creation date of the CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: CREATED_BY_NAME
column.comment: CREATED_BY_NAME -  This column holds the name of the Customer Representative which  created the CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: CREATED_BY_PHONE_NUMBER
column.comment: CREATED_BY_PHONE_NUMBER -  This column stores the phone number of the Customer Representative  which created the CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: CREATED_BY_DEPARTMENT
column.comment: CREATED_BY_DEPARTMENT -  This attribute holds the department of the Customer Representative  which created the Customer Order.

column.name: STATE_RD
column.comment: Status des Kunden (Aktiv/Deaktiv) -  Ths column stores the CUSTOMER ORDER State. e.g. defined, rejected,  released.

column.name: STATE_DATE
column.comment: -  The Date the current CUSTOMER ORDER State is effective.

column.name: TYPE_RD
column.comment: -  This column specifies the type of a CUSTOMER ORDER. This attribute  allows to distinguish between CUSTOMER ORDERs generated  automatically (SAP Orders) and those generated manually (CR created)

column.name: PRIORITY_RD
column.comment: PRIORITY_RD - This column is a priority level indicator.

column.name: RESERVATION_ORDER_INDICATOR
column.comment: RESERVATION_ORDER_INDICATOR - This is an indicator specifying whether an Order is a reservation  order or not.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.comment: Description

column.name: MAILING_ID
column.comment: MAILING_ID -  This column contains a unique system defined identifier for the  MAILING.

column.name: REGION_RD
column.comment: Kundenregion - This column stores Region in which the Customer Order will be  executed.

column.name: CUSTOMER_TRACKING_ID
column.comment: -  This column stores an identification number, supplied by the  CUSTOMER used to reference the CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: SALES_ORGANIZATION_ID
column.comment: SALES_ORGANIZATION_ID -  This column is manually entered by the CR and represents the number  of the Sales Organization within Arcor.

column.name: CONFIRMATION_OUTPUT_DEVICE
column.comment: CONFIRMATION_OUTPUT_DEVICE -  This column specifies the output device on which the CUSTOMER  ORDER confirmation will be distributed to the CUSTOMER. The valid  choices will be provided through the CBM DOCUMENT TEMPLATE. Examples  include Printer, CD ROM,

column.name: CONFIRMATION_DATE
column.comment: CONFIRMATION_DATE -  This column is the date on which the CUSTOMER ORDER was completed  and confirmation is possible. The confirmation will be created and dis  tributed  to the CUSTOMER on the next available execution of the MAILING to  which the CUSTOMER

column.name: CONFIRMATION_SUBJECT
column.comment: CONFIRMATION_SUBJECT -  This column contains a short description related to confirmation of  the CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE_NAME
column.comment: -  This column stores the unique identifier for a template.

column.name: LAN_PATH_FILE_STRING
column.comment: LAN_PATH_FILE_STRING -  The Lan Path File String is a text field provided to the user in order  to capture the location of documents which are used to assist in the p  rovisioning process.

column.name: REJECTED_REASON_DESCRIPTION
column.comment: REJECTED_REASON_DESCRIPTION - The Rejected Reason Description is a text field which I used in the  event that a Customer Order is rejected, to describe why it was reject  ed.

column.name: LANGUAGE_RD
column.comment: -  The Language identifies the preferred language for the confirmation  letter.

column.name: SALES_REPRESENTATIVE_NAME
column.comment: SALES_REPRESENTATIVE_NAME -  The Sales Representative Name is the Name of the Sales Representative  who is responsible for the Customer Order.

column.name: SALES_REPRESENTATIVE_DEPT
column.comment: SALES_REPRESENTATIVE_DEPT -  The Sales Representative Department is the Department of the Sales  Representative who is responsible for the Customer Order.

column.name: SALES_REPRESENTATIVE_PHONE_NO
column.comment: SALES_REPRESENTATIVE_PHONE_NO -  The Sales Representative Phone Number is the Phone Number of the Sales  Representative who is responsible for the Customer Order.

column.name: CONSULTANT_NAME
column.comment: CONSULTANT_NAME -  Consultant Name is an informational attribute which represents the  name of the consultant.

column.name: CONSULTANT_DEPARTMENT
column.comment: CONSULTANT_DEPARTMENT -  Consultant Department is an informational attribute which represents  the department which the consultant resides in.

column.name: CONSULTANT_PHONE_NUMBER
column.comment: CONSULTANT_PHONE_NUMBER -  Consultant Phone Number is an informational attribute which represents  the Phone Number of the consultant.

column.name: PROVIDER_TRACKING_NUMBER
column.comment: PROVIDER_TRACKING_NUMBER - This number is a tracking id for a provider. It is basically a  reference number to find the customer order through the search functio  nality.

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_USER_ID
column.comment: - Audit information capturing user id of last update

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_DATE_TIME
column.comment: - Audit information capturing date and time of last update

column.name: UPDATE_NUMBER
column.comment: -  Version number of the row. The version number starts with a random number and is  incremented on each update.  Update and Delete operations verify that the number in the database is equal to the  number used in the SQL statement (optimistic locking).

column.name: phon_sales_representative_name
column.comment: name of sales person

column.name: SUPER_CUSTOMER_TRACKING_ID
column.comment: SUPER_CUSTOMER_TRACKING_ID - Root barcode id

column.name: SCAN_DATE
column.comment: SCAN_DATE - Date on which the customer order is scanned

column.name: ORDER_ENTRY_DATE
column.comment: ORDER_ENTRY_DATE - Date on which the customer order is set

column.name: RELEASE_DELAY_DATE
column.comment: RELEASE_DELAY_DATE - Date on which the releasing of customer order is postponed

column.name: PARENT_CUSTOMER_ORDER_ID
column.comment: PARENT_CUSTOMER_ORDER_ID - The id of the parent customer order related to the current order

column.name: OFFSET_RELEASE_DAYS
column.comment: OFFSET_RELEASE_DAYS - Offset for release customer order after packaging

column.name: CANCEL_REASON_RD
column.comment: CANCEL_REASON_RD - The reason for the cancellation of the order

column.name: ACTION_NAME
column.comment: ACTION_NAME - FIF action name that created the order
